ElementQuerySelectorAll.summary:
The method querySelectorAll()
returns a static (not live) representing a list of elements
matching the specified group of selectors which are descendants of the element on which
the method was called.

remarks.para:
-Locating DOM elements using selectors
-Attribute selectors in the CSS
Guide
-Attribute selectors in the MDN Learning Area
-
- and
- and

ElementQuerySelectorAll.returns:
A non-live containing one object for
each descendant node that matches at least one of the specified selectors.
NOTENote: If the specified selectors include a CSS pseudo-element, the returned list
is always empty.
